result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Rakotz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $1,000.00 cash bond posted to be applied towards restitution and Court costs.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must follow through with mental health treatment plan with Dr. Hussein.
Must take T4C class.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

records.addlTxt:
clerked by RWinger

Defendant Nicholas J Rakotz in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Defendant Nicholas J Rakotz in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 16CM67,16CM215, 16CM271 and 16CF336

16CM67 & 16CM215 - Motion for sentence credit. State does not object. Parties determine only 16CM67 needs to be amended. Court orders 16CM67 be amended to increase the sentence credit by 28 days for a total of 102 days sentence credit. 

Defendant withdraws for purposes of today the previous substitution of judge to submit pleas before Judge Bitney to the following cases: 16CM271 & 16CF336.  Sentencing to be held before assigned Judge Babler. 
16CM271 - Dismissed and read-in. 
16CF336 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. PSI ordered. Sentencing set before Judge Babler 3/17/17 at 2:00 PM.

JAIL FAXED.
Motion hearing on January 18, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Notice and Motion for Sentence Credit
Revoked
Judge's copy

Defendant Nicholas J Rakotz in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant Nicholas J Rakotz in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 16CM67 AND 16CM215. State makes argument. State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant makes statement.

Court relates and orders: 
240 days jail on each count to run concurrent. 74 days credit for time served.
Huber privileges for work, work search and for treatment.
Court costs be reduced to judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Clerk's copy
from Attorney Krave to Court dated 7/20/16 not objecting to restitution order
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

16CM215  (plea and sentence hearing)

Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
